issue.title: [C++] Define common abstract APIs for database clients
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3101](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3101). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Most databases feature common notions:

- Connection
- Session
- Operation or Cursor
- Result set
   
  Result sets for example should support a standard API for conversion to an Arrow record batch (though some databases may require additional options for some conversions)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3101?focusedCommentId=16587987) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Relevant input for this could be found in the blog posts that outline turbodbc's design decisions: https://tech.blue-yonder.com/making-of-turbodbc-part-2-c-to-python/

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3101?focusedCommentId=17285949) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I'm not sure what the intended use case. Is this satisfied by the C data (or stream) interface?
